data.title: Edmund Lowe
data.text:
AKA Edmund Dantes Lowe

Born: 3-Mar-1890

Birthplace: San Jose, CA

Died: 21-Apr-1971

Location of death: Woodland Hills, CA

Cause of death: unspecified

Remains: Buried, San Fernando Mission Cemetery, Mission Hills, CA

Gender: Male

Race or Ethnicity: White

Sexual orientation: Straight

Occupation: Actor

Nationality: United States

Executive summary: What Price Glory

Wife: Esther Miller (div. 1925)

Wife: Lilyan Tashman (actress, m. 1-Sep-1925, d. 21-Mar-1934 cancer)

Wife: Rita Kaufman (costume designer, m. 2-Apr-1936, div. 1950)

Hollywood Walk of Fame 6363 Hollywood Blvd. (motion pictures)

Hollywood Walk of Fame 6601 Hollywood Blvd. (television)

FILMOGRAPHY AS ACTOR

Heller in Pink Tights (29-Feb-1960)

Plunderers of Painted Flats (23-Jan-1959)

The Wings of Eagles (22-Feb-1957)

Around the World in Eighty Days (17-Oct-1956) · Ship's Engineer

Good Sam (1-Sep-1948) · H. C. Borden

The Strange Mr. Gregory (13-Dec-1945)

The Enchanted Forest (8-Dec-1945)

Dillinger (2-Mar-1945) · Specs Green

Dangerous Blondes (23-Sep-1943) · Ralph McCormick

Call Out the Marines (13-Feb-1942)

Men Against the Sky (6-Sep-1940)

I Love You Again (9-Aug-1940) · Duke Sheldon

Every Day's a Holiday (18-Dec-1937)

Murder on Diamond Row (6-Nov-1937)

Espionage (26-Feb-1937) · Kenneth

Mad Holiday (13-Nov-1936) · Philip Trent

Seven Sinners (Jun-1936)

The Garden Murder Case (2-Jan-1936)

Grand Exit (25-Oct-1935)

Black Sheep (14-Jun-1935) · John Francis Dugan

Bombay Mail (6-Jan-1934)

Dinner at Eight (29-Aug-1933) · Dr. Wayne Talbot

Guilty as Hell (5-Aug-1932)

Chandu the Magician (4-Aug-1932) · Chandu

The Cisco Kid (1-Nov-1931)

Born Reckless (11-May-1930)

The Cock-Eyed World (20-Oct-1929)

In Old Arizona (25-Dec-1928) · Sgt. Mickey Dunn

What Price Glory (23-Nov-1926)

Eyes of Youth (26-Oct-1919)
